Cancer: Cancer is a disease that is caused by the abnormal growth of cells and can affect any part of the body. By curing cancer, we would improve the quality of life for millions of people and reduce the number of deaths caused by the disease.

Alzheimer's disease: Alzheimer's disease is a degenerative brain disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. By curing Alzheimer's disease, we would improve the quality of life for millions of people and reduce the burden on their families and caregivers.

Parkinson's disease: Parkinson's disease is a movement disorder that affects millions of people worldwide. By curing Parkinson's disease, we would improve the quality of life for millions of people and reduce the burden on their families and caregivers.

Type 1 diabetes: Type 1 diabetes is an autoimmune disease that affects the body's ability to produce insulin. By curing Type 1 diabetes, we would improve the quality of life for millions of people and reduce the number of people who suffer from this disease.

Polio: Polio is a viral infection that affects the nervous system and can cause paralysis. By curing polio, we would eliminate this disease and prevent millions of people from suffering from paralysis.
